page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY-WEST NOTTINGHA
page.content: Local history. 1066 Basford had land taxable for 60 acres,a priest,1 acre meadow;1acre woodland.There was probably a church, with land cultivated in strips.There's no trace of Roman or British occupation of the parish,nor do know when the AngloSaxons,or Danes settled. 1478 Sir.N.Langford was the biggest land owner in Basford,owning 310acres. 1669 There was a conventicle in Basford.1797_1491 acres land enclosed.1811_Nov23 frame breakers attacked workshops in Basford,this was luddism.1820_First house was built on the"Lings",New-Basford.Nat.Schools at Old&New-Basford&Cinder-Hill had accom. for 1366 children,there were Council Schools at Old-Basford,accom for 2418 children.1862-1 bleacher,Lincoln St. 1875-Aug,goods&coal traffic began.1876 Railway open.1900Many bleaching firms.
